ContentClassification.TableReference: George King, “Supplement to the Seventy-Fifth Annual Report of the Registrar-General of Births, Deaths, and Marriages in England and Wales. Part I – Life Tables”, T. Fisher Unwin (London, 1914). Reprinted James W. Glover, “United States Life Tables 1890,1901, 1910, and 1901-1910 with Explanatory Text, Mathematical Theory, Computations, Graphs and Original Statistics, also Tables of United States Life Annuities, Life Tables of Foreign Countries, Mortality Tables of Life Insurance Companies”, Department of Commerce, Bureau of the Census (Washington, 1921). Accessed: March, 2014 from http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/lifetables/life1890-1910.pdf
ContentClassification.TableDescription: English Life Tables (ELT) Number 7 (1901-11) – Male. Basis: Age Nearest Birthday. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 100
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Foreign country tables, reprinted in tabular form, were taken from the published life tables or various countries, based on their official population and death statistics so that a comparison may be made as each age. 1000qx copied to the nearest second decimal. When only the first decimal was given, a cipher was added. Based on the censuses for England and Wales (i.e. not for all of the United Kingdom) for the period 1901 and 1910 and the deaths registered in those 10 years. Methodology: Tables for males and females prepared along identical lines, the mean population for quinquennial groups being determined in each case by the method of Mr. A. C. Waters. Mr. King’s construction A method is then followed to determine quinquennial pivotal values for the rates of mortality at ages 12 to 97, inclusive. Interpolated values for ages 17 to 92 inclusive by the use of logarithms. No assumption is made at the extreme old ages with respect to termination of the table at a definitive age but a fourth difference series of values for log px is determined from the values at ages 89, 90, 91, 92 and 97. The rates of mortality for ages 0 to 4 inclusive are determined from the death returns at individual ages and a readjusted average population. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 04/2014.

MetaData.TableDescription: English Life Tables (ELT) Number 7 (1901-11) – Male. Basis: Age Nearest Birthday. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 100
